title: Beijing Will Save Housing Projects, But Not Necessarily Developers
sub_head: To head off a deepening housing downturn, Beijing is backpedaling a bit on tough leverage rules. That might not be enough to save weaker developers.
body:
After a tumultuous 2021, Beijing needs a stable housing market this year—not least because the clock is ticking down to this fall’s 20th Party Congress, where Xi Jinping appears likely to bid for a precedent-breaking third term at the Communist Party’s head.
That doesn’t necessarily mean struggling property developers will have an easier time.
